COLMAR, LTD., Plaintiff-Appellant,
v.
FREMANTLEMEDIA NORTH AMERICA, INC., Defendant-Appellee.
No. 1-02-3533.
Appellate Court of Illinois, First District, Fourth Division.
December 4, 2003.
*1019 Charles R. Trieschmann, Evanston, for Plaintiff-Appellant.
Jonathan S. Feld, BeLinda I., Mathie, Emily J. Henson of Katten, Muchin, Zavis & Rosenman, Chicago, for Defendant-Appellee.
Justice GREIMAN delivered the opinion of the court:
Plaintiff, Colmar, Ltd. (Colmar), appeals from the trial court's order dismissing its complaint seeking to vacate an arbitration award entered in favor of defendant, Fremantlemedia *1020 North America, Inc. (FMNA). Colmar argues on appeal that the trial court erred by affirming the arbitration award because (1) the arbitration award was void due to the fact that defendant was represented during the arbitration by an attorney who was not licensed in Illinois; (2) the arbitrator exceeded his powers by refusing to hear material evidence, ruling on an issue not submitted in plaintiffs complaint, and failing to consider all of the arguments presented in plaintiffs complaint; and (3) public policy demands that the trial court vacate the award. Colmar further alleges that the trial court erred by dismissing the complaint for failure to state a claim upon which relief could be granted. We affirm the order of the court below.
